You will be brought to the document editor so that you can make changes before confirming the reversion.

Enable or disable the use of the Lucene query syntax.
Quick ref:
Wildcards: ? and * (not at start of word)
Fuzzy search: append ~ to end of word
Boolean operators: AND, OR, NOT (in uppercase),
+/- before a word to require/prohibit it
Grouping using ( ) is supported.
All documents styled as bulleted list
All documents having a part containing an image
Documents of which the last version has not yet been published
In case of using the 'chunked' stylehint, please specify the 'chunk_length' option
The two passwords are not equal.
Receive email notifications of document-related changes.
Receive email notifications of user-related changes (only when having role Administrator).
Receive email notifications of schema-related changes.
Receive email notifications of collection-related changes.
Receive email notifications of ACL-related changes.
Receive email notifications when comments are added or removed.
Language & country setting to use for notifications:
Receive notifications for the following documents:

Add entries of the form "document id,branch,language", one per line. Use * as wildcard for any of the components.
Some examples:
15,main,en
receive notifications for document 15 on branch main and in language en
15,*,*
receive notifications for document 15, whatever the branch and language
*,*,en
receive notifications for all documents in language en
*,*,*
receive notifications for all documents on all branches and in all languages (if you add this one, you don't need any other one)
Receive notifications for documents that are in the following collections:

Add entries of the form "collection,branch,language", one per line. Use * as wildcard for branch and language.
For example:
mycollection,*,en
receive notifications for all documents belonging to collection mycollection in language en
(leave blank to get all documents, use % as wildcard)

Usually you should leave this on.
Disabling the validation can sometimes be useful:
You want to mark a document as retired, without having to bother with updating its content to match changes that might have occured in the document type.
The document type changed since you started editing, and hence it is impossible to make the document correct (since the document editor corresponds to the document type at the moment you started editing)

Marking a document as private makes it only accessible for its owner, regardlesss of the access control rules.
However, be aware that administrators will always be able to see and read the document, even if it is private.

Select documents on which the task should be run

Enter documents, one per line. Each line should adhere to the following form: document id, branch, language. Specifying branch and language is optional, the main branch and the default language will be used if not specified. Branch and language can be specified by ID or name. Comments can be added to the end of the line or on separate lines by starting them with a # symbol.

message.p: This list only shows scheduled and failed timers. Successfully completed timers are deleted after execution.
To stop a timer from executing, you can suspend the process it belongs to. You can do this from the process details page, accessible by clicking on the process ID.

Start a search and replace task on your current document basket.
To start search and replace on a single document, navigate to that document and select 'search and replace' from the tools menu.

message.p: Case sensible means the replace action will try to preserve the style used in the searched text, following these rules:

ul.li: If the original text is all lowercase, the replacement text will be all lowercase.
If the original text is all uppercase, the replacement text will be all uppercase.
If the original text starts with uppercase and ends with lowercase, the replacement text will be capitalised (only the first letter in uppercase).
For other cases, the replacement text is left unchanged (as entered in this form).
